question.title: How to customize package name with XMLBeans
question.body:
How can we customize the package name of the code generated by XMLBeans?

Here is the GitHub repository try_xmlbeans.

The package of generated sources is directly tied to the version of the namespace.

generated-sources#
├── annotations
├── com
│   └── chepseskaf
│       └── model
│           └── metadata
│               └── system
│                   └── Model
│                       └── TypeSystemHolder.java
└── x0
    └── x0
        ├── chepseskafModel1
        │   ├── Client.java
        │   ├── ClientDocument.java
        │   └── impl
        │       ├── ClientDocumentImpl.java
        │       └── ClientImpl.java
        ├── chepseskafModelBook1
        │   ├── BookType.java
        │   └── impl
        │       └── BookTypeImpl.java
        └── chepseskafModelPerson1
            ├── AdresseType.java
            ├── PersonneType.java
            └── impl
                ├── AdresseTypeImpl.java
                └── PersonneTypeImpl.java

The 'repackage' option has no effect.

<plugin>
  <groupId>org.apache.xmlbeans</groupId>
  <artifactId>xmlbeans</artifactId>
  ...
  <configuration>
    <repackage>com.chepseskaf.model.metadata</repackage>
  </configuration>
</plugin>

Can I force the package name?
